roleset.name: withdraw, remove oneself, removal from a source
roleset.note: WITHDRAW-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia, 10/2010. Member of Vncls remove-10.1, resign-10.11, escape-51.1-2, withdraw-82-3. (from withdraw.01-v)
WITHDRAWAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia. Corresponds to Vncls remove-10.1, resign-10.11, escape-51.1-2, withdraw-82-3. (from withdrawal.01-n)

example.name: unstated Arg1
example.text: Many factors led to [the company]-1's decision *trace*-1 to withdraw from the bidding.

example.name: with Arg1
example.text: John withdrew his feet from his mouth.

example.name: args 1 & 2
example.text: And earlier today President Bush again rejected calls for a timetable for withdrawal of US troops from Iraq /.

example.name: adjectival arg1
example.text: US Army General George Casey the head of coalition forces in Iraq talking this past week about the possible start of US troop withdrawals next year

example.name: agentive self-withdrawer-- arg0
example.text: Netanyahu 's withdrawal leaves Likud leader Ariel Sharon as the only candidate running against Prime Minister Ehud Barak , but former Prime Minister Shimon Peres tells Israeli radio he 's considering running .

example.name: another arg0, with arg2
example.text: British Airways rose initially after announcing its withdrawal from the UAL deal .

example.name: all args
example.text: Presidents of 3 Baltic Sea countries issued a joint statement on August 31st , pointing out that Russia 's withdrawal of troops from the 3 Baltic Sea countries would " strengthen European security " .

roleset.name: symptom of loss of drugs from the body
roleset.note: WITHDRAWAL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on nouns-00080. No VNcls. (from withdrawal.02-n)

example.name: both args
example.text: Her cocaine withdrawal was especially difficult.
